data.title: Wonderful!
data.body:
I have wanted a sunrise/sunset simulation alarm for years but could never justify it while I was a college student. Now that I have been out of school for a few years and settled into my career I finally took the plunge and I am so happy that I did. This is one of the most valuable purchases I have made in my adult life.

Getting up in the morning has never really been difficult for me. I am an early bird for sure. I haven't slept in past 9 in probably 5 years. In the summer I usually bound out of bed as the sun rises. In the winter? Not so much. It is dark and cold and even the most gentle alarm from my phone would jarr me awake. I have had this alarm for about 2 weeks now and it is the dead of winter and I have woken up feeling refreshed every morning, which translates to more energy and focus throughout my day.

I really like the design. It is simple and minimal - something I am slowly transitioning more of my life towards. It was also really easy to set up. Those reviews saying it was too hard and giving it a bad review obviously didn't read the instructions. I skimmed through the manual and had it figured out in about 10 minutes.

The front display has adjustable brightness which is a huge plus. There are 3 settings: bright, middle, and off. I keep mine in the middle. I appreciate that the display is an orange color - not blue or white. Less pain to the eyes if you have to check it in the middle of the night.

You can set 2 different sunrise alarms which is helpful since I wake up later 2 days off my week and like that I don't have to reprogram it for those mornings, I just hit the button for which alarm I need. The sunrise alarm can be adjusted in a variety of ways:
- time (duh)
- alarm sound (I like the bird song but there are a handful of other choices)
- brightness level: it always starts from off then you can adjust how bright it gets by the time the alarm actually starts at you programmed time.
- how far before your alarm it begins to brighten

I have my "sunrise" programmed to start 15 minutes before my alarm is set to start. It goes from off to a deep red/orange to yellow and finally to white. The maximum brightness will absolutely light up a whole room. That is a bit much for me so I have it turned back just a little. I am typically awake sometime around yellow. This wakes me up so much more gently and I have a few minutes in bed before the "alarm" of birdsong actually gets me up. So I am awake before my alarm most days and getting out of bed right after my alarm goes off. No more poking at my phone for 10 minutes trying to get myself out of bed in the morning.

The "sunset" can also be programmed, however there is only one setting, not 2 as with the morning alarms. It can be adjusted to your liking in the following ways:
- how long the "sunset" lasts
- starting brightness
- sounds played (less options here than the sunrise but more relaxing, I like the rain the most)

From the starting brightness that you program over the designated amount of time it slowly dims from white to yellow to orange to red and finally off. I have mine set for 20 minutes and I typically read a paper book as the blue light from screens is counter-productive. Once I stop being able to easily read that is usually about when my body is drifting towards sleep. It finished darkening while I snuggle fully into bed and off I go to dreamland.

It does have the ability to change the color of the light but the default works just fine for me.

I absolutely love this product. I do have 2 small qualms but nothing to take away from a 5 star review. I notice it more in during the "sunset" but the transition from light to dark is not very smooth, I definitely notice it click down with each level. It may be due to my settings and I will see if having a longer period of time to transition from light to dark with smooth that out. My other issue is in the mornings. Once my alarm goes off and it is at full brightness I wish there was a way to turn off the alarm sound but keep the light on. There is a "snooze" button but I haven't tried it yet so I may experiment with that.

In the short time I have had this product I can honestly say it has changed my morning routine and also the effects on the rest of my day. My sleep is more restful and waking up is so easy. It has really helped my mental health and I literally cannot stop raving about it to friends and family. If you are considering purchasing a product like this I highly recommend starting here. There are more much more expensive models but this one is accessible and user friendly.

data.title: Peaceful, Easy Feeling!
data.body:
I purchased this based on all the reviews despite some of them talking about the clock not working after a few months. It comes with a lifetime warranty which plenty of other users have indicated they had no problem with customer service replacing if there's an issue. I reached out to customer service around 10pm to get my warranty registered and they responded in 9 hours (overnight).

There are so many customizable options which I found fun and useful (though other users found that as a negative - too many choices). Yes, it has lots of buttons that have to be pushed to scroll through the various options. But again, the whole point is that it is super customizable to your wants. I used it to wake up this morning and set it for a 30 minute "sunrise" with birds chirping. It worked perfectly and I was already starting to wake up early in the sunrise process but was also able to tell how much longer I had to sleep in based on the brightness of clock. By the time full brightness was reached, I felt like I had been slowly waking up, I was not groggy, and I felt ready to take on the day!

I prefer to sleep in total darkness, so I liked that this clock has a feature to turn off the display very easily. You can also dim it, but I like that you can shut it off automatically and then when your alarm goes off it automatically turns on to medium brightness by default.

The lights can be dimmed, and the brightest setting is VERY BRIGHT! You can set the brightness setting to any level you desire for it to crank up to for the end of sunrise.

It has some night time features as well where you can have it set for anywhere from 10 minutes up to 8 hours for a light pattern and/or sound to be going off and then slowly become dimmer or softer until it shuts off at your desired time.

There's a button on the very top of the clock that you can use to turn it into a night light without messing up any other settings in case you needed to use it to get up in the middle of the night.

There are two alarm settings each one customizable. And each alarm setting has the option to make it go off on weekdays only, weekends only, or everyday.

Overall, I'm very pleased with my purchase - and have already convinced a friend and a cousin to purchase one as well!

data.title: Effective and pretty
data.body: Just purchased to help me get up on time during the dark winter months, this is alarm has been really helpful! The sunrise alarm feature is effective and yet unobtrusive. I wake up calm and not jarred out of sleep with an ugly alarm beep. Best feature is the additional USB port to plug in other small electronics. The variety of colorful light options and soundscapes are a plus. Would love more soundscape options to chose from, but overall v happy with this purchase.

data.title: I finally found an alarm that successfully wakes me up!
data.body:
I LOVE this sunrise alarm clock! I was comparing this one to others that are more expensive, bought and then originally returned this one thinking I’d like the Swarmir Smart Light Noise Machine that has a phone app and more color features. I immediately regretted returning this one after trying out the sleep-aid and wake-up alarm functions on the Swarmir. While the other color options for ambience and the phone app are awesome, there are several things I like WAY more about the Jall and bought this one again!

PROS / What the Jall Wake-Up Light alarm does better:
- I find the manual buttons are easier to use on this one vs. the Swarmir (though the phone app for Swarmir is also easy to use).
- I LOVE the wake-up alarm sound options much more. The wind chimes sound is my favorite and none of the others that I looked at had it.
- The sleep aid for the Jall clock ACTUALLY helps me fall asleep with the sound and light gradually decreasing until they softly go off. The Swarmir does decrease sound volume and light brightness too but suddenly cuts both off when the timer ends, which is jarring and wakes me right back up again.
- I surprisingly prefer not having an app to control it, I need this alarm to force me to get up and turn it off. The whole reason I wanted a sunrise alarm was because 1/2 asleep me is too cunning for the iPhone or other phone alarm apps. Phone alarm goes off, 1/2 asleep me taps the phone without getting out of bed, then falls back to sleep within seconds. The ability to turn off the Swarmir alarm with its app causes the same problem—a quick tap on the app while I'm still in bed and it’s off while I pass out again. I set up this Jall clock across the room so 1/2 asleep me has no choice but to get out of bed.
- Jall has a battery that saves your pre-set alarms, sound choices, and volume settings. The clock cannot run on the battery alone (has to be plugged into an outlet to work) but if you unplug it to move it somewhere else it will turn back on with the correct time and your settings still saved.

CONS / What the Swarmir does better and what the Amazon description for Jall does not make clear:
- With this one, you cannot use any of the other color settings with the alarm clock, they are purely ambience lighting you can turn-on whenever, but they are separate from the alarm clock. The alarm only uses the orange/yellow/golden light with the alarm to simulate the sunrise (which is still nice).
- You can set the Jall alarm sound to FM radio BUT you cannot choose any channel you want. The clock will automatically scan for stations that come in clearly enough and will pre-set them itself. You can then choose from those 20 pre-set stations, but if your favorite stations do not come in clearly enough the Jall clock will skip over them. I liked maybe 2 out of the 20 that it pre-set for me.
- If you're looking for the super colorful, swirling, rainbow fading in and out ambience lighting, this Jall clock is not for you. You can set solid colors or set it to shift through all the colors but they stay solid (fading to one color at a time). This is where the Swarmir one has the Jall beat big time—the color features with the Swarmir are gorgeous.
- The bottom 1/2 of the Jall clock where the time and LED display show do not light up or show the colors (that part stays dark and shadowy). The Swarmir has a full light-up display so the entire circle is colorful.

TL/DR: While this Jall Wake-Up Light does not have a phone app and does not have all the other color modes for ambience lighting like the Swarmir, I very much prefer the wake-up and sleep sounds, and it’s actually doing its job by waking me up on time in a way that’s pleasant (and doesn’t make me want to throw the alarm out of my 3rd story apartment window 💜). Full disclosure: I did also buy the Swarmir Smart White Noise Machine for the colorful settings and ambience, and I use both every day—Jall to wake-up and fall asleep, and Swarmir for ambience lighting, white noise while I work, and for daily meditation.

**Will update with a video that plays each wake up and fall asleep sound option from this Jall model vs. the other model I also bought for those of you interested.

data.title: Best purchase of 2020!
data.body:
The Jall Wake-up Clock is wonderful! I bought it for myself, to help my body wake up more gradually, rather than be woken up suddenly. Starting my day with a jolt of adrenaline leaves me feeling wiped out for the rest of the day; and, let’s face it. The year 2020 has been a living nightmare. I couldn’t handle the insomnia and chronic fatigue any longer. We live near a police station, and this year there have been more nearby, nightly disturbances than in previous years. Therefore, more blaring sirens at night. It’s made it hard to fall asleep. Also, difficult to wake up, feeling refreshed. So, I bought this alarm clock, because of its sleep function and wake-up light. I desperately wanted to avoid paying for its much more expensive competitor, priced just over $100. This Jall Clock being less than half that cost, I had to give it a go.

I must say, it truly works! The light, so long as it’s not set to one of the colored variants, has such an inviting tone. A yellowish hue that’s reminiscent to a sunrise, but perhaps closer to a flickering candle . . . but without the flickering part. My perception of the color’s tone might have to do with the fact that my bedroom walls are painted a rich, tan color; the light reflecting off that is very relaxing and warm—incredibly easy on the eyes. Which is key, for this sort of alarm clock. Anything too harsh could jar you awake. And the point is to allow your body to wake up gradually. It is fairly bright though, if turned up all the way to level 20. Level 15 is my preference. I set the alarm to begin the light function about 30 minutes before I want my alarm to go off. You can, however, set it anywhere from 10 to 60 minutes prior to when you want the alarm to chime. Often, I’m wide-awake before it ever makes a sound. I absolutely love the Wake-up light function! There are up to eight different alarm sounds to choose from: songbirds, ocean waves & seagulls, splashing creek, typical alarm beep, windchimes, piano & songbirds, slower piano, and FM radio. My two favorites are the songbirds and windchimes. All the recorded sounds are rather nice. They don’t have that cheap, appalling tone to them that some other Sound Machines do. Volume levels go from 1 to 16, with 16 being VERY loud. I set mine to 10, typically. Knowing there are six more clicks I could go up does give me more peace of mind. Say there’s an early appointment I can’t miss. Alarm beep at volume 16 will get me out of bed in a hurry. Most likely, the light function will have woken me up before then, and I’ll turn that sucker off, then leap out of bed, refreshed and ready for the day.

This clock’s got a nice sleep function too. There are three sounds to choose from: pouring rain, crickets & campfire, and flowing river. You can set it to remain on for 10 to 120 minutes, with up to 20 brightness levels. I personally prefer level 10, for falling asleep. It gradually fades from whatever level you set it at, to 0 after the timer finishes. My husband loved this feature so much, he asked that I buy a second clock for him. And he’s not typically one to do that sort of thing. I can’t recall a time he’s ever said something to the effect of, “Hey, would you buy one of those for me too?” It’s just not like him. That’s how wonderful this clock is. The longer he’s had it, the less he keeps hitting the snooze button, before finally dragging himself out of bed. He has been falling asleep faster, and has gotten higher quality sleep. The same holds true for me.

So far, this clock has been my best purchase of 2020. After several weeks of using it, my sleeplessness and chronic fatigue have diminished greatly. I am one happy customer. For the price, I highly doubt you’ll find a better Wake-up light clock than what Jall offers. That is why I give this clock a resounding Five Star rating.

data.title: It's okay - not a great dawn simulator
data.body:
I have been using a Phillips light alarm for years but purchased this because the Phillips model doesn't have the option for a light-only alarm (w/o sound).

Pros:
-different light colors (I only used the bright dawn option)
-different sound options (I only used the silent/no sound option)
-flexibility with the length of 'dawn' (how long it takes for the light to fully brighten)

Cons:
-size - the lamp is small comparatively, which means even though the light is bright it does not light up the room to simulate dawn - so it's very easy to keep sleeping because it's not enough to wake you up.
-dimmer option - the dimmest display option is still very bright in a dark room and keeps me awake. The next option is no display at all, which means you don't have any way of knowing what time it is if you wake up during the night
-the snooze option maxes out at 20 minutes. So because this doesn't light up the room and turns itself off after 20 minutes, it's easy to fall back asleep or keep sleeping.

After using both - I definitely prefer the Phillips option specifically due to the brightness of the light & how it lights up the whole room, and how I can keep the light on (vs 20 minute limit).

Biggest benefit with this is the silent alarm option, but because the light isn't bright enough there's not much of a point. I didn't use any of the purple or orange light color or bird/ocean etc noises. Just wanted a simple, bright dawn simulating alarm and this falls short unfortunately.

If your goal is to minimize light at night/throughout the night and maximizing light in the morning, this won't fully provide what you need. Too much light overnight and too little in the morning.

data.title: Helps me to wake up and is worth it!
data.body: This clock is so affordable and very easy to use. The audio is great and there are many functions including different wake up lights and sleep audios. It's very easy to set a timer and customer support responds quickly to assist you if needed. I would highly recommend this alarm clock; I have trouble getting out of bed but the light has made it easier as I use black out blinds. I will be continuing to use this product and I would recommend it especially over the hatch alarm clock.

data.title: My mornings have changed for the better!
data.body: I absolutely love the sunrise feature. I set it to begin the "light up" 30 minutes prior to my phone alarm going off. I opted to use my phone for the alarm for personal preference. The clock does have an alarm with some nice sounds. I wake up in a panic sometimes thinking I way overslept only to realize it was the light and I still have a few minutes to slowly wake up prior to my alarm. I wake up much less groggy for sure. The con is that it is difficult to setup initially in my opinion. This is likely because it provides so many different options, including how bright you want the light, color of the light, scheduling of light vs alarm sounds, sunset options, mood lighting, etc.. I just simply use it for the light in the morning and a very dim clock at night (you can even choose the time to be bright, dim or not show at all). Overall, this has been a game changer for me in the mornings.

data.title: Setup was a little tricky, but otherwise solid item
data.body:
Recently set this up, and so far I'm really liking it! Ability to pick nature sounds, different light intensities for the alarm, and a few options for how far in advance the light gradually starts to light-up before it reaches the selected intensity at the designated alarm time. Option to have light only alarm, sound only, or light and sound at same time. The sound only comes on at designated alarm time. So far I've only been able to figure out one light colour for the alarm itself (wake-up/sunlight) although mood lighting comes in many different colours. There is a quick-on nightlight option by pressing the snooze button at the top middle, which is the only knob button so it's easy to feel and so you're not fumbling around when half-asleep, trying to switch on a light. I like the fact that you can get FM radio as well, since this is the only non-internet device on our house (other than emergency radio) that gets radio, which seems like it might come in handy from time to time. The FM auto-tune works pretty well. No AM radio as far as I can tell.

I will share one thing that messed me up the first time I ever setup an alarm. Moral of the story, TLDR: You may need to setup and run both alarms once initially to get them to start behaving correctly.

Here are the gory details of the setup issue and what I did to fix: Initially, I followed the instructions and setup Alarm 1. It was a Friday, so a weekday. I made sure the day of the week Alarm 1 slider on the back was on the right setting: I set it to every day of the week. Alarm 1 did not go off. I triple checked everything, including the AM/PM setting on both the clock and alarm. Still no dice. At this point, Alarm 2 was off (no 2 indicator on the display) and the Alarm 2 slider was on weekend only. Since it was a Friday evening when I was doing all this seup, effectively for this purpose Alarm 1 was enabled and Alarm 2 was disabled. Well, here's the brain breaking part. After my third or fourth unsuccessful Alarm 1 attempt, I decided to move on and instead setup Alarm 2. I enabled Alarm 2 (confirming on the display) and moving the slider to every day of the week. Once the Alarm 2 time rolled around, Alarm 1 went off! My selected sound for Alarm 1 played, and Alarm 1 flashed on the display. Not Alarm 2; Alarm 1! Worried that this meant perhaps the sliders were flip-flopped, I did a couple more experiments. After this, I was unable to replicate the issue. I reset and enabled Alarm 1, turned off Alarm 2, and this time Alarm 1 worked. I reset and enabled Alarm 2, turned off Alarm 1, and everything with Alarm 2 worked just fine. I know this makes no sense, and as an analytical person it bothers me that it seems to be a weird fluke. Either way, the alarm has worked properly several times since then, so ultimately everything worked out.

data.title: Responsive Company
data.body:
UPDATE:
After leaving the review below, I was contacted by the company in less than 24 hours. They stated they believe I must’ve received a defective clock since they’ve never before received the complaint I had. I received a replacement within 2 days. As long as the new alarm comes on everyday as it should, then I give it 4 stars. I’m only deducting 1 star because I wish the volume of the alarm could be louder.

ORIGINAL REVIEW:
At first I loved this alarm clock. The light helped me wake up and I keep it on my dresser so I have to get up to turn it off. My only complaint was that I wish the volume was louder. A few weeks after getting it I overslept and realized I never heard the alarm go off or saw the light come on. I thought maybe I just slept really hard and slept through it (although unlikely). Not long after I decided to start setting an alarm on my phone again for a couple minutes before this alarm was supposed to go off because I found that because I tend to cover my face when sleeping, the light wasn’t always waking me before the alarm. Now that my phone alarm is waking me up I’ve realized that this alarm is not coming on at all some mornings. The light doesn’t come on and the alarm I have set on it doesn’t sound. I’ve changed no settings but sometimes it works and sometimes it doesn’t. It’s not a power issue because the clock is still on and shows that the alarm is set.
An alarm clock is useless if you can’t rely on it to work. Unfortunately I’m past the return period so I’ll be looking for something else.

data.title: Wonderful alarm and customer service!
data.body:
I was tired of being scared awake from my phone alarm every morning, and having trouble getting out of the bed timely when it was still dark and cold out. I decided to give this light a try and now there’s no going back! 99% of the time, I wake up to the light alone without sound. (I use the sunrise clock with the light alone, I use my phone as a backup with sound.) Even if I am sleeping facing away from the light, I wake up because it gets THAT bright. I’ve consistently gotten out of bed faster and also in a better mood. I find the night light/reading light to be SO useful and wish I had it while I was nursing the babies overnight.

But what makes this alarm clock really outperform others in its same price range is the wonderful customer service. My alarm clock had a bug that happened very infrequently- only 3 times in the past 3 months with daily usage. I emailed customer service just to see what remedies they might have and they responded within 24 hours and resolved the issue! It definitely exceeded my expectations and I am so grateful! I love this alarm clock and 100% recommend it for its functions, the price, and the outstanding customer service.

data.title: Great communication with seller
data.body: Thank you to the seller for great communication. They offered me a refund because I couldn't figure out how to change the clock time. They also gave me great instructions on how to adjust the time. Changing my review from 3 stars to 5. I am planning to use this on a transatlantic cruise where there are numerous time changes and we have booked an inside cabin. My previous review said "The Time change occurred and I can't easily reset the time. It works well as a night light/sunrise clock. It is just challenging to change the time on the clock without digging out the book. It is not very "intuitive." Sound machine and light are great"

data.title: Recommend if you want to wake up more peacefully
data.body:
I bought this lamp because I dreaded waking up to my annoying alarm and wanted a more peaceful wake up. I've been using it for two weeks and here is my review.

For the first week of using it I only wanted to use the light to wake me up because noises in the morning bother me. However I wasn't able to wake up just with the light so I added on the sound. I put the bird noises at lowest volume and I wake up perfectly fine. The low level of noise isnt loud at all and the birds are natural sounding.

I love keeping on my light while i get ready and motivated, very calming. The only thing i wish the clock had was a no sound option on the snooze setting. I mean when i snooze the first time and the alarm comes back on, there will always be sound unless you turn it off, which then turns the light off. So I set my "mood light" to a sunrise color and turn that on while I get ready.

I haven't tried the fall asleep mode and tried the radio once but unfortunately it could not pick up on any channels near me, but I wasn't planning on using the radio anyways.

Overall, I love the clock and how I actually wakeup peacefully feeling good instead of dreading getting up and constantly snoozing my alarm. The light is especially nice when I have to get up early and its dark outside or during winters daylight savings time and sunrise is later. Not to mention its pretty cheap (compared to the hatch brand) and works as advertised. Definitely recommend if you're trying to wake up more peacefully.

data.title: Love this thing!
data.body: I purchased this alarm clock because I wanted something that woke me up gradually instead of abruptly. I will admit that I struggled with the instructions a little, but don't let that intimidate you. That's just me. I set the unit up both ways: one morning with the sunrise setting and one morning without. On the third morning, my alarm clock did not work. The face was completely blank. I adjusted the cord, thinking that something was loose. Nothing happened. I switched outlets, still nothing. I contacted the selling and reported that my alarm clock had died. Ann was so responsive and helpful. She began troubleshooting with me when I noticed the problem: my cat had chewed the wires off in the middle of the cord! I ordered a new one, plugged the unit in, and once again, it worked like a charm. To my delight, the little battery inside did exactly what it was supposed to do. It saved all of my personal settings. 5 stars for a great product and great customer service. I definitely recommend this!!

data.title: This is a lovely sunrise clock!
data.body:
I love that the clock has so many settings; sounds, brightness and volume. I’m really tied into the sun; if it’s dark outside, even if it is 10am, my brain would tell me to go back to sleep because it’s “dark” (therefore still too early to wake up). This helps with that problem since it wakes me more naturally and helps my brain to switch on!

If you have trouble waking up and need something different or want to add to your morning alarms, this is a great product. The customer service is also very receptive and helpful!

data.title: I'm so grateful for this clock
data.body: This clock helps me wake up and not feel groggy! It is totally customizable. Personally I have set it to look like the sunrise, increasing in intensity by 10% for 30 minutes before my alarm, which is the sound of birds go off. I also love the light options and enjoy using the multi colored lamps to set different ambiance throughout the day, such as when I'm studying or relaxing. The manual is super helpful and makes set up super easy and straightforward. It comes with a lifetime guarantee and the customer service people are so great and kind. I also ✨️really appreciate✨️ that this clock is significantly more affordable that other sunrise alarms and yet has SO many different customizable features. I am on a very limited income and really needed a clock to help me get up earlier than I have been without feeling groggy so it's much, much appreciated! I highly recommend this alarm clock! Thank you a ton!!

data.title: Good purchase
data.body: Very happy with this overall. Completely changes the entire wakeup experience. I have blackout curtains for privacy, so it's hard for me to wake up suddenly to my phone going off, in complete darkness. I set this clock to gradually increase the light 10 minutes before my alarm time, so I wake up "naturally" because it mimics a sunrise, rather than being startled awake by my phone alarm. Good number of clock brightness settings (actual time/numbers), ambient noises, etc. Lots of customization options. Much better wakeup experience, especially for someone who hates getting up in the morning.

data.title: No more waking up in the dark!
data.body:
I stopped using an alarm clock years ago when I decided to wake up naturally. Even though I enjoy waking up early, I have difficulty waking when it’s still dark. This awesome clock now lets me wake up at “sunrise” but I get to say when that is! Once I’m up and about and starting my morning routine, it doesn’t matter that it’s still dark outside. And it feels like I’ve added time to my day whether for getting things done OR for just enjoying a day off.
So if you need more time in your day, you’ll want to try this alarm clock for a much gentler but effective way to start the day. I prefer the sunrise. But you can wake up to your favorite morning sounds - or both!

data.title: Overall good
data.body: This alarm has worked well for helping me get up earlier. I only use the light alarm, not the sound. It has more bells and whistles than I need. The only issue that I've noticed is if I manually turn the alarm light off while it's in the dim stage, if I actually get up before the bright alarm time, the alarm won't turn on at it's set time the next day even though the symbol is showing that the alarm is still set. I have to press the button to turn the alarm symbol off and then back on again for the alarm to resume working at the set time. Now that I've figured that out I just wait until after the time my alarm is set for to turn the light off.

data.title: I like the concept, not crazy about the included alarm sounds
data.body:
This review is for the Wake Up Light Sunrise Alarm Clock for Kids, Heavy Sleepers, Bedroom, with Sunrise Simulation, Sleep Aid, Dual Alarms, FM Radio, Snooze, Nightlight, Daylight, 7 Colors, 7 Natural Sounds, Ideal for Gift sold by Jall Store

I needed a reliable clock not tied to my smart phone and it's flaky battery and really wanted to try a sunrise clock but didn't want to spend over $100 to discover I didn't like them. So here I am... Overall, I'm enjoying the concept. The light output is more than enough and the light color range is also nice (soft warm glow to bright white which you can limit when you set the alarm). I initially chose use a 20 minute wake up cycle (light only, full spectrum, no sound), and I've woken a few times just 5-10 min into the cycle (no alarm sound). Absolutely love those days. I've also slept through it because my pillow was over my head... Since, I really can't afford to not wake up on time, I decided to utilize the build in alarm sounds.

Glancing through the list, Ocean caught my eye. I though Ocean would be nice, and at first, it sounded fantastic. Crashing waves, rhythmic - not too fast, and not too slow, not high pitched - just a good ocean wave crashing on beach sound. I though I'd found the perfect match to my sunrise - yes, Zen was in my grasp. Then a few seconds into the track the @#$@ seagulls start squawking. Seriously, why? Have you ever spent time around Seagulls, they're loud, obnoxious and they'll steal anything they can carry. That's not what I want to wake up to in the morning. What's next, soundtracks for a crowded beach, or maybe a sinking supertanker blasting it's horn or a lighthouse fog horn at point blank range so my ears can bleed? You had one job...

Unfortunately, the other offerings followed the same pattern - all seemed just as harsh (too high pitched, disruptive and not in tune with a soft sunrise IMO).
- birds chirping in the morning - yes, I know birds chirp in the morning. At my house, they're in a tree, over 20 yards away and not trying to be reproduced out of an alarm clock speaker less than a foot from my ears.
- stream sound (like a steady peaceful river flow sound) - again too high pitched and too fast IMO.
- windbells - I'm just going to stop you there and note in this case word combo should be wind CHIMES - as in mid-high pitched chimes and not those lovely lower pitched bells that your verbiage implies
- piano music - Not even once in my life have I wished to wake to a piano (or for that matter drums, trumpets or triangles)

Ok, I'm a bit over the top on these alarm sounds, but you get the point. I'm not a fan of this part of the clock. There's a lot of opportunity for improvement.

My answer was to set alarm 1 with no sound, alarm 2 follows later with sound... If alarm 1 doesn't gently wake me like it should, alarm 2 certainly will, but I'm going to have a rushed morning..

Does it have an FM radio, yes. Will you want to use it - I seriously doubt it.

Per JALL's reply in the Q/A section of this product when asked about the Radio:

Please know that when you hold the radio button down, the clock will scan all the available stations automatically and save them as P-01/P-02/P-03 and so on ( up to 10 channels ). You don't need to do anything until it finishes the process.
After finishing, the clock radio will select P-01 channel by default. If you want to change channel, please hold "+"/"-" to select P-02/P-03 and another channel

Just 10 channels? no way to delete unwanted channels to keep scanning the higher frequencies to reach the channel you want? Where I live, 10 channels doesn't even reach the first decent rock or country station. However, I'm pretty sure this isn't the new digital FM frequency tuners, so 10 might just cover it all in a few more years.

Despite what I feel are failures in the extra features, from a basic standpoint - an alarm clock that simulates sunrise & a 30 min sunset it works, and it works quite well. Yes, better alarm sounds and a functional radio tuner would have been nice, but I'm still happy with my purchase. They also include a bunch of labels/stickers so you can choose to label the clock controls (or not), and you can choose if you want them to be seen when the lamp is glowing or just put them on the opaque body (other side of the inputs). So, for these reasons, I'll give it 4 stars and keep using it until something better comes along.

data.title: The best way to be woken up!
data.body: Bought this in 2020 and it's still going strong. I've pretty much kept the same settings for all that time - 30 minute "sunrise time" and at the alarm time the birds start chirping. The gradual sunrise slowly stirs me out of sleep to the point that I'm pretty much awake by the time the birds start. The birds gradually get louder too, so it's another gentle way to get you going. So much more pleasant than a traditional alarm. I really like this device. It's portable enough to travel with, and your settings are saved after unplugging and plugging back in.

data.title: THIS IS THE ONE! (After DAYS of research of reviews and recommendations.)
data.body:
3 CLOCK BRIGHTNESS display levels - INCLUDES OFF!
High is great for daytime, medium is soft and clear for nighttime, and the display brightness level is easy to adjust with a dedicated button for this function on the right side.

20 WAKE-UP LIGHT levels: which are adjustable to your preference both in brightness and 'sunrise' length. Seamless transitions between the different light levels. The light levels are also adjustable by function (alarms & sleep.) The wake-up light turns itself off after 15 minutes, which is convenient, as by then we have the nightstand light on, and a cup of coffee to quietly start our morning.

YES you can easily turn the alarm sounds OFF!
My husband already has his tablet programmed to wake us up with different original songs every morning, so I was only looking for the graduated light feature. Since I do not use the wake-up sound options, I'll skip reviewing those, except to say that there were one or two that I found pleasant. I did not test the radio feature, our station options here aren't stellar.

ALARM ON-OFF feature - there is visible display indicator when the alarm is on. When lowering the clock display brightness at night, it has been easy to remember to turn off the alarm on Friday night! When turning the alarm back on it will display/flash the alarm time so you will know it is correct. (This is not the light's start time, but its wake up time. Start time will be 10, 20, or 30 minutes before your set alarm time, depending on your interval choice.)

PROGRAMMING & BUTTONS - some found this confusing, I did not. A careful look at the diagram in the setup instructions, and then following the directions step by step made the setup easy and successful.

(I agree with other reviewers in this - SAVE YOUR INSTRUCTIONS, you will need them if you decide to change your programming later.) Intuitively - the buttons were reversed from what my English speaking brain expected... that is, buttons I THOUGHT would be on the right are on the left. This really isn't an issue though - any new and unknown apparatus requires getting familiar with its operation. (Think of the way we have to learn to automatically use an instrument console when we buy a different car.)

Sunset and different colors - are not options that I have used, but they were bright, colorful and pretty when I was exploring and setting up my Sunrise Alarm Clock.

Personal notes: I HATE having an alarm slap me awake in the midwinter darkness, which induces a lovely deep REM sleep in me. Even the quiet lovely music we play to wake up in the morning is startling when I'm deeply asleep and the room is dark. Every winter's nightmare mornings. So, this winter I decided to look for a Sunrise Alarm to bring some, albeit artificial, light into my midwinter mornings.

This unit is a complete success. We've been using it for a few weeks, and while I don't always wake up to the light, which we have on a soft light setting, and a 10 minute 'sunrise' interval, I'm no longer startled awake from a deep sleep in the blackness of the morning. My husband also likes this Sunrise Alarm. It is quite lovely to wake up to a soft light in the room, already floating up towards consciousness. Regarding location of the unit - we've placed it across the room, on a dresser. It is easy to see the clock display from there, and it softly brightens the room from the dresser top as well. (I did NOT want to be startled awake by a light in my face either!)

I twice spent DAYS researching reviews and recommendations both here on Amazon, and in general web searches. This particular Sunrise Alarm Clock was NOT listed in the web recommendations, but it became clear to me that it had the best features/options for what I needed. It was hard to find this particular one in the jumble of similar looking products, but it is worth the search!

I seriously considered several Phillips models, BUT, there were features missing in some of these that were important to me, and a large number of people reported that the expensive units failed around the end of warranty mark. My husband's comments about that (as all electronic items can be glitchy) was that we could buy an awful lot of more economical units for the cost of one Phillips! In the end, Phillips just did not offer the product that I was looking for. JALL did! And I'm happy that this was my first choice!

data.title: Just buy it already
data.body: I love this. Would be nice if it could connect to Bluetooth and had more options for the "white noise"/bedtime sounds, we weren't crazy about most of the alarm sounds either. It's super great though, it's plenty loud and very bright. I like that it's dimmable and the different colored lights are a hit with the kids. Definitely would recommend, I've bought 3 of these now.

data.title: This is a great product for the price, also comes with many great features!
data.body:
I live in a room that has no windows, so I have no sunlight come into my room. For the longest time this made waking up for me very difficult, especially during the pandemic when I was forced to work from home and didn't really have a routine. I saw the price point of the alarm clock which was much lower than some other alarm clocks on Amazon that also have the artificial sunlight feature, so I went ahead and bought one.

I was really surprised at how well it works. Set-up was very easy, it only took me about 5 minutes to unbox the alarm clock, set the time, and set two alarms. No other set-up is required unless you're wanting to set up extra features from the get-go, but I only bought the alarm clock for the artificial sunlight. Controls feel a little strange at first, but are easy to learn and get the hang of. I still have the manual but I haven't looked at it after I first set my alarm clock up.

The artificial sunlight works great and the light it produces looks very natural. It's also nice that you can set the sunlight to start anywhere between 10 - 60 minutes before the alarm goes off. The light will start at a dim red and will gradually become brighter as the alarm gets closer to going off. I have my first sunlight set to start 60 minutes before the alarm goes off and I find myself waking up a few minutes before my alarm goes off everyday. The artificial sunlight really helps, and on most mornings I feel well-rested when my alarm goes off instead of confused and groggy.

The alarm clock has some extra features built into it, such as a radio player, different colors of light you can make it shine (other than yellow for sunlight) for mood-setting in your room if you wish, and a sleep mode. I haven't really dabbled in the other features besides the sleep mode, so that's the only extra feature I will review. Sleep mode is something you can set up on a given night, and it allows you to set up a light that starts off bright but then gradually gets dimmer (basically the opposite of the artificial sunlight for the alarm), as well as play a loop of a sound for a given amount of time, and the sound can play for up to two hours (though you can of course set the amount of time that the sound plays for). There's only three sound settings available for the sleep mode to play: Rain drops, river, and campfire (which plays fire and cricket noises). You can also set the radio to play for sleep mode if you wish. I've found the sleep mode helpful on occasion, and it's a great extra feature. The only downside is that there's only three different types of sounds to play for sleep mode. More variety would be nice, but for an extra feature built into the alarm I can't really complain. Sleep mode also does not re-occur every day like alarms, it's something that you have to set up manually for each night you want to use it. This is actually something that I like because I don't use sleep mode every night, only on occasion.

Two quick things I want to mention is that while the alarm does not connect to the internet, it does have built-in memory, so if you unplug the alarm the time on the clock and any alarms you set up will be saved once it's plugged back in. The brightness features for both the alarms and sleep mode are also optional, as well as any sounds associated with them. So for instance, if you just want to be waken up by the artificial sunlight but don't want to have an alarm sound to go with it, then you can set an alarm up to not play sounds. And for sleep mode, if you don't want a dimming light to be on your alarm clock, then you can turn that light off and just let soothing sounds play.

Overall, this alarm is great for the value and quality, and I'm happy with my purchase. It also comes packed with features that I didn't even consider or care about prior.

Pros: Great price, great natural artificial sunlight, great extra features like mood-setting lights and sleep mode, semi-large plug-in cable, easy-to-use buttons and set-up, charging port in the back of the alarm to charge devices like phones (this is very useful if your night stand doesn't have a charging port close enough by), a lot of customization options for alarms, sleek design, built-in memory, optionally allows batteries to be put into the bottom of the alarm so that it will continue to work during a power outage.

Cons: No internet connectivity, meh sound quality, not a lot of sound loop options for alarms or especially sleep mode.

data.title: Love this clock
data.body: I am old enough that I am tired of hearing the blaring beep of harsh alarm clocks. I bought this clock for my spouse for her birthday and then requested that she buy one for me for my birthday! I love the sunrise feature, and I am able to choose from different sounds for the alarm itself. I chose chirping birds, and I love waking up to that sound. I would highly recommend this clock to anyone who wants a different alternative that is more soothing than traditional beeping alarm clocks.

data.title: Nice Alternative to Alarms
data.body: This is a great way to wake up in the morning. It's much more gradual than a jarring alarm or even a radio station. There isn't much contrast between the face and the numbers so seeing the time can be a little difficult but overall, I'm very happy and even happier to ditch my old alarm clock! There's a night light feature that is super handy when you're transitioning to sleep at night.

data.title: Definitely wakes you up
data.body: My wife struggles with getting up in the mornings so we thought we'd give this light alarm a try. We also placed it on the other side of the room so one of us (me) would have to get up to turn it off. I have found it to be very effective, the light fills the whole room and the alarm can be made nice and loud so it's almost impossible to ignore. I wouldn't say that the "pre-alarm sunrise" feature is as effective at slowly waking you up as it could be, but all in all it does it's job well.

data.title: Gentle Wake Up Perfect For Anxiety
data.body:
So I have really bad anxiety and that makes waking up to an alarm clock an issue. I'm not sure how it works but if my alarm clock noise or how it wakes me up is too jarring sometimes I'll end up hyperventilating and freaking out when the sound of it jars me out of my sleep. Even when I'm not tired I'll stop or snooze the alarm when it goes off on reflex just because I want the noise to stop so, as you can imagine, there isn't much success with me and regular alarms. I tried this in the hope that the light would make it a little harder to ignore but I didn't expect it to change my entire wake up routine.

So for my alarm I have it set to start brightening up 10 minutes before it's time for me to get up and my alarm noise is water and seagulls so that way it's something calming yet loud enough to warrant a reaction from me. Much to my surprise it's the light that wakes me up more often than not usually the brightness of the alarm waking me up maybe 2 or so minutes before the alarm goes off which gives me time to kind of settle into being awake and shuffle across the room to get my alarm. The gentle wake up I've had has changed my mood so much in the mornings and definitely changed the pace of my day in a way I hadn't expected.

If you're like me and quick with a snooze or stop alarm and just generally hate being scared awake I'd say give this a try and you won't regret it. It's only been 3 uses so far and this clock has proven to be one of my best purchases ever.

data.title: Some of the most seamless and peaceful mornings I've had
data.body: While i've only had this clock for a week, I must say that I have felt a significant rise in how easy it is for me to wake up in the morning. As someone who needs to be up before the sun rises, whenever I would wake up it would feel abrupt and unnatural. Since trying this, I have felt rejuvenated in the mornings with the clock's warm light and great alarm sounds. I would definitely recommend it to anyone struggling in the mornings. Even with a poor night's sleep, this clock helps me a lot.

data.title: Life changing clock + top notch customer service!
data.body:
I’ve struggled my whole life with my sleep schedule. I’ve listened to podcasts, watched TikTok’s, read articles… all of it! I understand the importance of a consistent wake up time so I decided to try this clock.

Having light in my eyes first thing is key! If I get up to turn off my phone alarm I’m just not alert enough. But the light in my eyes from this clock removes a degree of sleepiness that would normally have my mind saying “just go back to bed”.

I’m not exaggerating when I say this clock has been the key to getting up early to work on my personal projects before work! It’s absolutely life changing!

The customer service is outstanding. I reached out when my clock seemed glitchy. They quickly replied & replaced it. And sent a couple follow up emails to ensure I was back on track ☺️. So thoughtful!

The fact that you can email them to resolve any issues means that you’ll never be stuck with a clock you don’t love!

data.title: Bought this instead of Hatch
data.body: I love this alarm clock the light is very strong and the settings are super customizable. I didn't need all the fancy gadgets that come with the hatch nor the price so I bought this and loved it. I'm not a morning person and it has helped me wake up at any time that I set. On weekdays, I have it set to have noise and the full brightness and on weekends in order to encourage me to not sleep in I have just light with no noise with a very gradual brightening and I found I wake up consistently now and sometimes even before the alarm goes off. it comes with a warranty which I really appreciate. I got my friend on this as well. Love it.

data.title: 3rd Purchased
data.body: This is our third purchase. These are perfect to help pre-teens and teenagers to create healthy sleeping habits and waking up on their own on time. Since we don’t allow cellphones in their rooms at night (prevents them from the temptation of playing, texting or YouTube from sunset to sunrise) this is a great alternative to having their own alarms. My youngest even travels with it. The sleeping mode allows them to fall asleep with soothing sounds and lighting and the alarm goes off in a similar manner. They are also well built, our fist purchase got banged around and dropped multiple times by a toddler and the thing still worked (minus the sleeping mode sounds). Since that was one of the features used by our teen, we went ahead and replaced it.

data.title: A bit difficult to set up BUT, once done, I am enjoying it.
data.body: I like the color choices as well as the fm radio option. Will use the wake up feature at some point but for now I’m just enjoying the music and soft lighting.

data.title: Customer service
data.body: The clock was easy to set up and much more peaceful to wake up to than a traditional alarm clock. I did have an issue with the alarm not going off even when set on random days. I emailed the customer service and had a response, which included acknowledgment of an issue and a replacement on the way that evening. They are the best customer service I have ever dealt with. They also offer a lifetime warranty on their products.

data.title: love it!!
data.body: I struggle to wake up to my phone alarm and actually stay awake. I have this set to the bright sun setting and the birds chirping audio and i LOVE it! I wake up noticeably easier and in a better mood! I also love how you can set the alarm to go off on certain days so i don't need to remember to set my alarm every day! Plus the white noise setting and the cool mood light you can use any time and i think thats a cool bonus! Very happy with my purchase:)

data.title: Great customer support - good budget alarm clock
data.body: Worked really well for a couple of months then I ran into an issue where the light wouldn't dim on snooze (I honestly shouldn't be snoozing, right!) Emailed customer support and they had not run into this issue before so are sending out a replacement. Would recommend.

data.title: Budget version of a sunrise alarm clock
data.body:
Feels cheap, looks cheap, is cheap. For the cost, that is to be expected. Complicated to set and program, not a very intuitive menu. Numbers are blurry through the plastic display. Radio sounds like a transistor at the bottom of a garbage can.

I have enjoyed waking up softly to the light before the actual alarm sounds, though. It definitely pulls you out of sleep in a more gentle way.

For the price, I’m not complaining. But if you want something that is aesthetically pleasing and easy to use, splurge for something more.

data.title: Light won’t turn off
data.body:
I really enjoyed the alarm clock at first. I’ve now have it for a little over a month (so past the return period) and the light will not turn off. Now there is a constantly a blue / green light on. Wish I could return it because it no longer has a use for me.

Update: the company reached out and sent me a new one that works great!

data.title: Great customer service
data.body: This is my 2nd one… the 1st one the sunrise function stopped working where it lights the room up gradually… they replaced it under warranty for free! That means a lot these days! Overall I like it and the functionality is as described! It’s a less harsh way to wake up!

data.title: Works with time change!
data.body:
Every spring forward time change I have a hard time waking up. I finally purchased this and it worked. I was wide awake, feeling refreshed before my alarm went off. I should have purchased this 5 time changes ago.
You can set the brightness of the light to your preference. If you have trouble waking up without morning sun get this!

data.title: Monster in the morning
data.body: I usually hate waking up early. Then wait until it’s stress crunch time to wake up to rush and get ready. This changed everything. I don’t use any sound and I have a back up alarm on my phone to wake me up just in case because I am a nervous Nelly. I keep thinking I won’t wake up to the light. Every day for the last two weeks I have woken up and been is a much better moood. It doesn’t wake up my spouse either which is nice. It completely changed my view of mornings. It’s my quiet time where I make my coffee and slowly get up when it’s time instead of freaking out

data.title: Nice sounds and light options.
data.body: The instructions were pretty easy to follow for set up and so far it is working well. I like the many light and sound options. Light intensity increases gradually in the morning based on my personal settings; makes it easier to wake up in the morning.

data.title: A gentle way to wake up for heavy sleepers
data.body: I sleep like the dead. I usually set alarms on my phone every five minutes for two hours to wake me up. This alarm uses the light to gently bring you out of deep sleep and has a nice alarm tone that is birds chirping- it has other options but this one is the most pleasant in my opinion- and it overall is very effective and a nice way to wake up. I still snooze this one a couple times, but no more than twice. I highly recommend!

data.title: Almost perfect but has dealbreakers
data.body:
Ok so this light is ALMOST perfect, but a couple things are now leading me to look for another alarm.

GOALS:
I wanted a silent sunrise clock. I use my phone to wake up to music, play meditation songs, ASMR, etc to go to sleep and to wake up. I don’t need or want the barely customizable plasticy sounds of an alarm clock whastsoever. I absolutely do not want to listen to a radio like it’s 1995 with ads, sports, news, and talking heads. I want to be able to use my curated Apple Music alarm clock playlist even if that’s just playing through my phone separately.

PROS:
the sunrise brightness settings go from a rich orange to yellow to white as it gets brighter. The lowest settings are dim enough and the highest settings are bright enough so you can completely customize your sunrise and sunsets final brightness and has a custom timer.

CONS:
It is literally not possible to turn the radio or sounds off on the alarm features. The instructions say if you don’t want sound then turn the volume to one, but even “one” is quite high when going to bed in an otherwise silent room.

You have to manually set the alarm every day. Your previous settings are saved but you still have to go through the steps of confirming each one.

EXPERIENCE:
The first day I did a 20-min sunrise to medium brightness, set to the actual time I wanted to wake up, but when you hit snooze (the easiest button to find) it turns off both the light and the mandatory music (I chose bird sounds as they were least annoying).

But the problem with turning the light off to snooze is you are defeating the entire purpose of having a sunlight alarm???? If it goes back to pitch black I’m gonna fall back into a deep sleep.

First of all, I don’t want to have to use this clock’s music at all, but now that I’m forced to, if I want to snooze the music I lose out on the only reason I bought it: to have soft light on in the morning to keep me from falling back asleep.

The workaround: You can hit the alarm button to turn it off, then manually turn the light back on. But you will need separate alarms on your phone or elsewhere if you’re not ready to get up yet for the day.

The second day I tried doing 40 mins to maximum brightness instead of 20 to medium, and I set it to 15 mins after when I need to start waking up, figuring it should be on medium by then and help get me up on time then I can lay in bed for a bit before having to get up to turn it off and then back on again.

There might be some trial and error in terms of how long the sunrise should be and how bright to work best for you. I face the light away from me so that on max brightness I’m not getting blasted in the face, and rather my faux silk dark curtains get illuminated and reflect the nice warm glow.

I was really excited about the sunset mode, something I’d never considered using, but would solve my problem of trying to get ready for bed in dim lights and slowly wind down, having a chance to go to bed with some light on without having to get up to turn it off later. Perfect idea…

But AGAIN it’s ruined because I have to listen to obnoxious crickets (only one I could stand) that are still fairly loud instead of, idk, silence??? Or my own actual music???

I won’t use the alarm this way but I believe the same problem exists for those that want alarm sounds but no light, it’s not possible to turn the light all the way off in the alarm mode either.

SUGGESTIONS TO SELLER
Have an option for level 0 with sound off for any setting
Have an option for level 0 brightness
Leave sunrise on when hitting snooze. If I didn’t have music playing I wouldn’t have to hit snooze at all which would be preferred.

Best case scenario would Be that this has Bluetooth that could connect to a phone.

TL;DR
It’s good a light alarm, it’s cheap and very lightweight but still looks nice.
Inability to turn sound all the way off is frustrating.

data.title: Sunrise Alarm Clock for Kids
data.body: I purchased this as a Christmas gift for my grandson. He still sleeps with a light on makes it perfect for him. It is also helping him learn to tell time.

data.title: Love the slower wake up
data.body: Overall, I like this alarm clock. The slower wake up with the natural light is helpful, although it is difficult to see the control buttons on the sides of the clock in the dark.

data.title: Love it but...
data.body:
While this alarm clock is great that it simulates sunrise/sundown lighting effects, it only does it in one color...orange. I was under the impression that you could do that with the other color LED lights that it comes with (purple/green sunrise and sunset).
Radio tuner takes some time to setup, dont throw away the instruction manual because you will forget how to do some basic things like setting up an alarm or change the LED lights.
Last thing, I dont know if this is a defect but the clock goes fast, by that I mean when you first setup the clock on it, it matches up with other clocks (on a cellphone, laptop) but after a few days or weeks, I noticed that it kept getting ahead of the clock by a few minutes but if you leave it alone for a few months, it will be ahead of most clocks by 30 mins, by then you have to fix the clock by making sure it matches the correct time.
That's just a minor inconvenience but just putting it out there to see if other people have encountered that.
It's still good and I use the sunrise/sunset feature. It's cool

data.title: Amazing Customer Service
data.body: I bought this a couple months ago and slowly but surely it’s helping me get up early and have a better sleeping pattern. It wakes me up slowly which helps me feel less agitated. The time stopped displaying after a couple months, but I reached out to the seller and they sent one within a couple days. They were very nice and understanding.

data.title: Come's with a lifetime warranty and set up was easy.
data.body:
This clock checks all of my boxes-

Brightness+
Loudness+
Groovy Colors+
Inexpensive+

The lifetime warranty I knew nothing about until I unboxed it was the cherry on top. Thank you for meeting all of my expectations. I'm pleased with my purchase.

data.title: Good wake up light for the price
data.body:
I’ve only had the wake up light for about 5 days now. My previous light died. So far the light itself is great. It has a gradual increase in light where you can select the length of time until full brightness and the maximum light setting.
I am not really interested in the other features like the alarm sounds, radio, sleep lights etc but they all seemed to work as I was setting up the wake up alarms.
I will say if you are not tech savvy or follow directions well this may be frustrating to set up. There are 8 buttons, a dial, and two switches all used for set up.
If I could change one thing I don’t love the color of the clock, it’s like an amber or red orange. But I can deal.

For the price this was a good purchase

data.title: Makes waking up so much more pleasant!
data.body: I love this clock. It makes waking up so much NICER now. I wake up at 5:30am so I can work out before clocking in for work. It's very dark here this time of year and waking up to this alarm light makes it easy to get out of bed and get my day started. After using it for four months, I started having issues with my alarm; the light would only turn on some mornings while the alarm noise continued to work. I emailed the support team and received a replacement two days later! I am so impressed with their responsiveness the desire to solve the problem. I am so happy to have this alarm in my life LOL.

data.title: Alarm clock
data.body: Overall does its job well! The sound is pleasant and the light does help the children wake up!

data.title: It works!
data.body: It has both brightness AND audio (birds, water, rain, etc) options to help wake AND sleep. I hesitate getting one because commenters for similar products have complained it gets bright too quickly instead of gradual like the sun. I got this as a gift so might as well try. For me, even if the clock gets bright too quickly, my body probably takes 15 minutes to realize, right when the audio I selected starts to chime in. I set my alarm like 20m ahead of when I need to be awake. Has snooze, weekday and weekend alarm settings. The digital readout is impossible to read when the clock is bright. The booklet font was so small for my aging eyes. BUT, I would get it again (a couple of my teenagers come to mind). Has lifetime warranty!

data.title: It somewhat works
data.body: So this was the first sunrise alarm clock that I tested and then I bought a higher priced competitor to see if there were any features that I was missing out on, I wasn't. It's hard for me to notice a difference in my wake up, but I think it's doing something. I don't use the alarm 7 days a week which if I did I'd probably be able to notice a larger difference but with 5 days, it's semi noticeable. I have had plenty of instances where I don't wake up to the sunrise instead I wake up to the alarm, because either I'm turned away from it or it just didn't wake me up that day. The features on this one are good, you can adjust the sunrise from 10 minutes and up, which is nice as some others have the minimum set at 30 minutes. I haven't had any issues with the button placements, once you get used to where they are it's easy to find them. One feature I was and am still somewhat annoyed by is the clock placement. When the sunrise is on, the clock isn't visible, which I was annoyed by this at first cause then I can't see what time it is, but then I think it made me wake up more to turn off the alarm cause whatever time it was, was time to wake up. It's a well featured product, the rotating knob at the top is a nice knob lol. Plenty of features with this one and especially for the price it's good. I'd recommend somewhat actually try this one out for a few weeks and see if they notice a difference as mileage may vary

data.title: Great once you get it going.
data.body: The thing is cumbersome to set, but dang once you get it set it is great. So much nicer to wake up to a “sunrise” than the iphone alarm.

data.title: Very satisfied, love the price compared to the brand name product
data.body:
I cannot compare to the brand name since I don't have one, but when looking at the features of both, this works the same and costs mich less
Love it

data.title: It’s very peaceful
data.body: I haven’t gotten to use all the features yet, but so far I love it. The instructions are detailed and easy to follow making setting it up a breeze. I would normally have a sound machine running plus my phone for the time and alarm; however, this eliminates the need for both and keeps me off of my phone from night time shopping.

data.title: Love it very helpful
data.body: I am in love with this thing! The only things I wish is that the instructions weren't so complicated and that the 'night light' part of this had a lower setting but besides that its awesome!

data.title: Love this alarm clock
data.body: I constantly sleep through alarms on my phone, so I got this for its light feature. It’s been a game changer and has helped me get on a better wake up routine.

data.title: So fun!
data.body: Bought for cruising in an inside cabin. Works beautifully! Wake up to simulated daylight with birds chirping instead of a harsh alarm.

data.title: Good settings for an alarm
data.body: The look and feel of the alarm clock is nice. I choose the grey fabric and couldn’t be happier. The most important things I was looking for was the options like having the ability to set the light intensity and dimming the clock or having it off. I don’t like any light when sleeping, however this one uses a warm yellow/orange hue light which is much better than blue or white light like many other clocks have. Also all the sounds options or being able to turn them off. The only thing I’m not so sure yet is how when you have the sleep mode and the light turns off. I wish it would do the same as the wake up light and fade out but instead it just turns off at the time set. A “sun setting” style would’ve made this clock perfect! So far, I highly recommend this clock.

data.title: HIGHLY RECOMMEND
data.body: I’ve had my eye on the Hatch sunrise clock for years. Never wanted to commit to the extreme price tag. Found this lovely very well priced sunrise clock and it does not dissapoint! So easy to use! So many features! The best part is it doesn’t need WIFI to work like that other clock does and it also doesn’t come with a monthly memebership charge. Give your nervous system the love it needs and wake up to sunrise and birds chirping (you can chose from other sounds) every day!

data.title: How to navigate the menus
data.body:
There is nothing to dislike. I like the design and the friendly user features of the clock. I would recommend it to anyone.
I think it is an awesome design.

data.title: Best type of alarm clock ever!!
data.body:
I kept seeing these advertised and wanted one for a year or so, but I only saw them for like $100+!! Last Fall, the first day I woke up to a totally dark room with zero motivation to get up, I checked Amazon and found this one for a much affordable price.

Y’all, I LOVE it!!!! You definitely get what you pay for. It’s not fancy. The settings and buttons are slightly complicated to set up and they aren’t a very intelligent set up. If you use it without sound, this is very sensory-sensitive friendly and makes waking up much less overwhelming and less overstimulating. (Neurodivergent person here!)

The alarm (“sunrise”) starts 10 minutes before your set alarm time and the Snooze function WILL NOT WORK until the actual alarm time. Example, my alarm is set for 6:30. The light starts to come on at 6:20 and if I decide I want to snooze, I can’t utilize the snooze until 6:30 so you have 10 minutes of unwanted light in your face. I did find you can bypass this slightly by turning the alarm off and back on again (a two handed job as the clock is light weight and slides around on my glass nightstand since the button to set the alarm is on the side edge). The light will go off at my set time then.

Also, if you snooze, the light comes on full brightness at the end of the snooze. It’s pretty intense. 😂😂

I rarely use the snooze option, which I give thanks and credit to this alarm clock for that. I used to be a chronic snoozer and this sunrise alarm has reduced that 95% or more!! I made use it once or twice a month now instead of like 5+ times every morning. 😂😂😂😂

I wake up in a better mood.

I do NOT use the sounds on this thing. Oh my gosh. I used them for like one or two days and about threw the thing across the room. The sounds are an AWFUL pitch and are on a very short loop. If you are sensitive to noises, I would recommend not using them. You’ll wake up in a bad mood. 🤣

The light alone is perfect (as long as I make sure the alarm clock is facing toward me). There have been a couple times I was rolled over and slept through it, but usually the light is bright enough to wake me up even if I am rolled on my other side.

I would prefer to invest in one of the more expensive clocks some day if they offer more settings and a bit more intelligent set up.

However, the quirks with this are pretty minor for the price. I highly recommend.

data.title: Awesome product!
data.body:
I have always struggled getting up in the morning and absolutely would not consider myself a morning person. The alarm clock on my phone always made it worse for me and I feel as if I never heard it going off.
I bought this alarm in hopes that it would be a better experience but also help me wake up in a more pleasant way. It absolutely has! It’s very bright, pleasant with the sound options, and absolutely effective.
I did have an issue with the first one I bought. I reached out to the customer service team and they quickly responded and worked with me on getting it fixed, and when it did not sent me a replacement. They were very nice and easy to get in touch with. I received my new one and it works good as new! I would 100% recommend this product to anyone in the market for a better wake up as I was. Has been an absolute game changer, and I reached out to customer service not looking for a replacement but to get it fixed by all means necessary because I value this product this much!!

data.title: So Fun!
data.body: I LOVE it! I use the sunrise color accelaration and set the alarm to the birds chirping and it is so much nicer waking up that way as opposed to the boring IPHONE. And I use the mood lighting at night while I'm relaxing. I highly recommend it!

data.title: Nice but not life changing
data.body: I would love to say this has made me a "spring out of bed bright eyed and bushy tailed" type of person. It has not. I suppose that would be asking a lot. But it's nice to wake up to. Generally I find that just the light is enough to wake me. Good quality, lots of settings options. Not exactly a super attractive night stand accessory.

data.title: Game changer for teens
data.body: If you're like me, a parent of teens, you know school mornings are sometimes tough. Those kids sleep so deeply that the alarm going off is such a jolt, they turn it off and roll over. This thing is a game changer. It is super easy to program-- my kids have theirs set for school days-- and easy to turn on and off for planned days off. The slow increase in light helps them wake up more naturally. There are a variety of sounds and shades you can program, including how soon before the alarm sounds that things start getting lighter. It isn't a cure-all for teenage oversleeping because let's face it, they are still teenagers, but it has helped a ton and we have a lot fewer crazed mornings from oversleeping alarms.

data.title: Lovely way to wake up
data.body: I bought this because I was looking for an easier way to wake up than being startled and starting my day in a panic. It works great. There are a bunch of superfluous features like nature sounds and what not. I just use it to wake me up with a slow sunrise. It's really helped me start the day in a more natural way. I also really love that you can completely dim the clock on it so it's totally dark at night. Brilliant feature.

data.title: Wake Up Light Sunrise Alarm Clock
data.body: Lovely clock with fabulous features. Customer service is superb. Great experience all around!

data.title: Really changes how I wake up
data.body: This is amazing. Bright enough to get close to natural light in the morning with a small window. I have had a much easier time rising in the morning. In fact, most days the alarm does not even go off before I am out of bed. My little one came in very early in the morning and the dull red glow told me I had just a little more time to sleep. It helps me go back to sleep to not know the time in the middle of the night too.

data.title: Replaced my phone alarm
data.body: Such a nice way to wake up in the morning. Easy to follow instructions

data.title: Best way to wake up
data.body: Being depressed and having to wake up at 5am every morning is ROUGH. I love this alarm, it’s refreshing and starts the day off great!

data.title: Not just for kids! Many features
data.body:
I ordered this for myself, not a child. Like previous reviews state, the sound quality isn't great, but the seller doesn't advertise that it is..... This is not a sound system.

Other reviews state there are a lack of sounds to choose that they reasonably like. I say, be open minded. There are 10 or 20 to choose from. I'm sure you can find a minimum of one you will like. I like multiple.

The great variance in volume is a plus for me as well as the multiple alarm settings. I use a calm, quiet waking sound and gradually brightening light with one alarm and use the second/later alarm much more bold, bright, and aggressive to be sure I don't oversleep.

Reading - the time and functions that are on the face lit up are ready to read. The small print on the back with controls, not so much.

When purchasing, I didn't think I would use other features; however, I have grown to enjoy sunset mimic and light therapy (without checking the wave patterns) as they have added some serenity to my routines.

data.title: A modern day alarm clock
data.body: This product was really helpful as an alarm clock. The dawn rising light feature in particular is a game changer for me.

data.title: Great basic sunrise clock
data.body: I was looking for a simple, inexpensive sunrise clock to help light up my room when my phone alarm goes off to help me get up during the dark winter mornings. This is exactly what I wanted. The brightest light setting is nice and bright. I honestly don’t use any of the alarm sound settings, I still use my phone alarm. But I like that you can either turn off or dim in 3 ways the digital clock on the light and there’s a handy USB charger that I plug my phone into. Very happy

data.title: Does its job well
data.body: This light is great for people who need to wake up with the sun even if's its too early. The brightness can be adjusted to suit and it's gone off faithfully since I got it. My only two complaints are #1 - the display. I bought this because it clearly stated that you can turn off the display as I detest any lights at all when I am trying to sleep and although you can turn it off, it comes back on if you touch ANYTHING on the clock. That's a nuisance for sure if you want to hit the snooze and the bright display is still on. You have to hit another button to turn it off, every. single. time. #2 - the other issue is the sounds. They loop and the soft sound of rain is pretty much ruined by a looping clash of thunder. Most people love the sound of rain but not so much a crashing sound of thunder when they are trying to chill. Wish those two things weren't an issue but aside from that, it works great!

data.title: Fully Featured Light/Alarm Clock/Radio at Very Low Price
data.body: Best feature/cost ratio of any clock sold

data.title: Worked well for the first couple months but that is it
data.body: This clock is great, the light, sounds, dual alarms and so when I couldn’t reset the time I was upset. I reached out to 3 Ducks and the customer service may even be better than the clock. They are sending me a new one after trying to troubleshoot the issue. I may be giving these to my3 college students for Christmas 👍🏼

data.title: Expectation surpassed
data.body: This is one of the best alarm clocks, I ever ordered, it has succeeded my expectations by 💯. I have been telling folks about this awesome clock and that, they need to purchase one.

data.title: Pat on the back for me for buying this
data.body:
I really like this alarm clock and I wish I had thought to buy something like this sooner. I’ve been using it for about 3 weeks now and it’s so much nicer to essentially feel like I’m waking up on my own (at the same time every morning, suspiciously), rather than being jolted awake by the sound from my phone.
